### WUROM A SÉ WUROM

Gyirik yi e raku<br>
De bale ba bang tɛ̂t mɛn<br>
beras na beha<br>
Na nèy mɛn arɔng<br>
Wurom a sé wurom<br>

Vɔ beras o ba vɔk gap sede cɔ́gɔt<br>
Ko shɛgɛsh beha ro be tok tɛ̀ netyang<br>
Ko ney o na se e ji yey pyɛng  kaye jeng<br>
Ko pyɛ de yɛn e simo na yin e tɔk e yE a<br>
Wurom a sé wurom<br>

Wot a sé bemat besi, kasâng a wot<br>
Wot e boros e ji netyang<br>
Ha Ne hyul-hyul babek mot<br>
ne shara hɛn bagat na yikyik<br>
Wurom a sé wurom<br>

Gwi gwa vɔk reto<br>
ko gwa sé rwat<br>
Mwat de a yông gwɛ a sé Wo Reto Mwa<br>
wot e yila hɛ “Dagwi” gbak-gbak<br>
Ano da bedabeda mot ba ha a wot<br>
Wurom a sé wurom<br>

### A Berom is a Berom

Coming down from the hills<br>
Whose tops are hidden in the clouds<br>
A group of men and women<br>
And their children too<br>
A Berom is Berom<br>

The men with arms as strong as trees<br>
And the women with smiles that could heal<br>
The children joyous as ever<br>
And all they want you to know is<br>
A Berom is Berom<br>

We are a people dark and lovely<br>
radiant and healthy<br>
The stories of our smooth skin<br>
Is known far and wide<br>
A Berom is Berom<br>

The sun is powerful and useful<br>
Whoever created it most be mighty<br>
We refer to him as God forever<br>
So our ancestor believed<br>
A Berom is Berom<br>
